result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Ramon Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

-Alcohol and Drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department;

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Ramon Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Juan Ramon Garcia in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
As to Count 1 as amended:  Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit of 4 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*No Contact with co-defendant, Eddie Campos.
*No use or possession of any weapons. 
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. Case adjourned in branch 45. Jury trial date of 12/2/15 was ordered vacated.

Defendant Juan Ramon Garcia in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial. In-chambers discussion held. On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to disorderly conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Ramon Garcia in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Morgan Willz supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court set matter for for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Court ordered that the QP reporter be turned over by 9/21/2015. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Ramon Garcia in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests another status conference date. No objection from the state. Court grants request.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Ramon Garcia in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel needs additional time to review discovery.  Defense requests a status conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Ramon Garcia in court.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned  to Br. 46  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/5/15 @ 1:30 pm
